programme.title: 2025 NBA All-Star Celebrity Game
programme.desc: The NBA All-Star weekend kicks off with the Celebrity Game and the Rising Stars practice and competition; Celebrity Game participants include Kai Cenat and Druski while Scoot Henderson and Keyonte George headline the Rising Stars.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing
programme.desc: Denys Berinchyk (19-0-0, 9 KOs) defends his WBO World lightweight title for the first time since beating Emanuel Navarrete for it on May 18; Keyshawn Davis (12-0-0, 8 KOs) enters the bout as the WBO Inter-Continental lightweight champion.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arkansas (15-9, 4-7) won three of its last four games, and won both meetings last season; No. 8 Texas A&M (19-5, 8-3) won four-straight games, and is 11-1 at home this season behind Wade Taylor IV, who leads the Aggies with 15 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 6 Houston (20-4, 12-1) won three-straight games, and is 6-0 on the road behind the top scoring defense in the country, holding opponents to 57.3 ppg; No. 13 Arizona (17-7, 11-2) is 11-1 at home behind Caleb Love, who leads the team with 15.8 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina (14-11, 7-6) is 5-9 away from home this season, but won 13 of the last 16 meetings; Syracuse (11-14, 5-9) split its last four games, but is 9-5 at home behind J.J. Starling, who leads the Orange in scoring with 18.6 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 1 Auburn (22-2, 10-1) rebounded from its Florida loss with an 80-68 win over Vanderbilt behind Johni Broome; No. 2 Alabama (21-3, 10-1) won seven straight, and leads the country in scoring, averaging 90.5 ppg behind Mark Sears.

programme.desc: No. 15 Kentucky (17-7, 6-5) comes off a 75-64 win over No. 5 Tennessee behind 13 points from Ansley Almonor; Texas (15-10, 4-8) dropped three straight, but is 10-5 at home behind Tre Johnson, who leads the SEC in scoring with 19.3 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 17 Kansas (17-7, 8-5) split its last six despite Hunter Dickinson, who is fourth in the Big 12 in scoring at 16.6 ppg and second in rebounding at 10.3 rpg; Utah (13-11, 5-8) is 12-3 at home behind Gabe Madsen, who leads the team with 15.3 ppg.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: NC State and North Carolina split wins in two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Tar Heels claiming an 80-70 victory in the final matchup on Feb. 22, 2024; Lexi Donarski posted 23 points and 4 rebounds for North Carolina in the home win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 14 Memphis (21-4, 11-1) won eight straight, including a 61-53 win over the Shockers on Jan. 23 behind 22 points PJ Haggerty, who is second in the AAC with 21.5 ppg; Wichita State (14-10, 4-7) won three-straight games, and is 9-4 at home.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: The James has been named the official and exclusive hospital of the upcoming 2024 APP Vlasic Classic in Cincinnati on May 7-12.

programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed a 70-62 victory over Duke in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Feb. 19, led by 23 points and 4 steals from Hannah Hidalgo; Reigan Richardson posted 23 points and 2 assists for the Blue Devils in the home loss.

programme.title: TGL Golf

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Atlanta Drive GC (1-0-0) is the only team that has yet to concede a hole after defeating New York Golf Club, 4-0, on Jan. 21; Los Angeles Golf Club (2-0-0) sits atop the SoFi Cup Standings after its 6-2 win over Boston Common Golf on Feb. 4.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cincinnati (15-9, 5-8) won its last three games after an 85-75 win over Utah; No. 10 Iowa State (19-5, 9-4) is 12-1 at home behind Curtis Jones, who is third in the Big 12 with 17.4 ppg, and won its lone meeting with the Bearcats last season, 68-59.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Oklahoma finished in first place over LSU in second in their first meeting of the season at the Sprouts Farmer's Market Collegiate Quad on Jan. 11; the Sooners posted 197.950 points for the win behind an all-around title from Jordan Bowers.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The four-day event, which is being staged for the sixth time, features 16 teams competing in 40 games, and there are 14 schools that appeared in the 2024 NCAA Tournament, including three teams that reached the Women's College World Series.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: West Virginia (15-9, 6-7) dropped five of its last seven despite Javon Small, who is tied for first in the Big 12 with 18.5 ppg; Baylor (15-9, 7-6) is 11-1 at home, and won its last six meetings with the Mountaineers after a 94-81 win last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 22 Mississippi State (17-7, 5-6) defeated the Rebels, 84-81, in OT on Jan. 18 behind 21 points form Riley Kugel and 18 from Keshawn Murphy; No. 19 Ole Miss (19-6, 8-4) won three-straight games, and is 11-2 at home behind Sean Pedulla.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Louis (14-11, 7-5) is 3-8 away from home despite Gibson Jimerson, who is fifth in the Atlantic 10 in scoring with 17 ppg; Loyola (15-9, 6-5) is 12-1 at home, and won its last two meetings with the Billikens after losing the previous six.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Miami (6-18, 2-11) won two of its last three games, and won four of the last five meetings after a 72-68 win last season; Pittsburgh (14-10, 5-8) lost four-straight games, but is 10-3 at home behind Jaland Lowe, who leads the Panthers with 16.5 ppg.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: The top knockouts in UFC history are showcased in full detail, including top brawlers scoring vicious strikes in championship bouts, rivals who want to leave their opponent cold on the ground, and newcomers testing their mettle against veterans.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview the Fight Night 251 card and the middleweight main event as Jared Cannonier (17-8) goes up against Gregory Rodrigues (16-5); other bouts include: Calvin Kattar (23-8-0) faces Youssef Zalal (16-5-1) in a featherweight bout.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes access follows Candace Parker through her 2022 WNBA season with the Chicago Sky as she pursues her third WNBA title, while also tracking her life back from her early days as an elite high school player at Naperville Central.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston breaks down fishing the thermocline, the transition layer between the warmer surface water and the colder deep water in lakes and oceans, discussing the challenges that come with fishing it and his tips for finding success.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Hand games have become a staple of young Black girls dating back generations, as the documentary traces the history of the games and the influence they have had on pop culture and the creative landscape, including music, dance and style.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Florida Atlantic (14-10, 7-4) won four straight after an 87-75 win over Charlotte behind 18 points from Kaleb Glenn; Temple (14-11, 6-6) is 10-1 at home behind Jamal Mashburn Jr., who is second in the country in scoring with 22 ppg.

programme.title: UDA College Dance Championship: Jazz
programme.desc: The top collegiate jazz dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Washington State (16-10, 6-7) ended a five-game skid with an 87-86 win over Pepperdine; Saint Mary's (22-4, 12-1) is 13-1 at home, and beat the Cougars, 80-75, on Jan. 25 behind 25 points from Paulius Murauskas and 17 from Augustas Marciulionis.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Bradley (20-6, 11-4) is 9-3 away from home this season; Drake (23-2, 13-2) won 11-straight games, including a 64-57 win over the Braves on Jan. 8, and is 12-1 at home behind Bennett Stirtz, who leads the MVC in scoring with 18.9 ppg.

programme.title: Women's Super League
programme.desc: Arsenal claimed a 3-0 victory over Tottenham in their first meeting of the season on Nov. 16, with goals from Alessia Russo, Frida Maanum and Stina Blackstenius; Kim Little and Mariona Caldentey tallied assists in the win away from home.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title.

programme.title: UDA College Dance Championship: Pom
programme.desc: The top collegiate pom dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: South Florida (12-13, 5-7) is 1-7 on the road this season; UAB (15-9, 8-3) won 13 of its last 15 meetings with the Bulls, including the last five after a 92-83 win on Jan. 15 behind 21 points from Christian Coleman and 18 from Tony Toney.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years, but "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan's fame peaked to unparalleled levels in the early 1990s in the wake of consecutive NBA titles and a starring role on the Olympic Dream Team, his image as "Air Jordan" made him a profoundly significant cultural figure.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Troy (16-9, 9-4) won five of its last seven games; Arkansas State (19-7, 10-3) is 12-0 at home, and won its last three meetings with the Trojans after an 84-78 win on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Taryn Todd and 17 from Joseph Pinion.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1992, Deion Sanders, who was a two-way player with the Atlanta Falcons and an outfielder for the Atlanta Braves, attempts to play two National League playoff games and an NFL regular season game in a span of 24 hours in two different cities.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan is left to begin the 1997-98 season without his injured sidekick Scottie Pippen, whose contract dispute with the Bulls' front office reaches a fever pitch as the team gets off to one of the worst starts of its championship runs.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: With Michael Jordan's extraordinary fame came extraordinary scrutiny, and in 1993, it all felt like it came to a head with the Chicago Bulls' pursuit of a third straight title shadowed by question marks about Jordan's gambling.

programme.title: League One Volleyball
programme.desc: The top two teams from the LOVB Classic battle for the Championship at Municipal Arena in Kansas City, Missouri after two rounds of knockouts; Atlanta and Omaha had byes from the quarter-finals being the no. 1 and no. 2 seeds respectively.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas, Joe Dumars, Rick Mahorn, Dennis Rodman and Bill Laimbeer led the Detroit Pistons to back-to-back NBA championships in 1989 and 1990, but the team's tactics earned them a tough reputation and a memorable nickname that has endured.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: With the help of Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, the Orlando Magic franchise vaulted to the top of the NBA in the 90s and became a pop culture phenomenon, but as with all stories, the fairy tale came to an end when Shaq departed for the Lakers.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Practice
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency for the Daytona 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: DePaul (11-14, 2-12) is 1-8 on the road; Xavier (15-10, 7-7) is 11-2 at home, and won its last five meetings with the Blue Demons after a 77-63 win on Jan. 11 behind 20 points from Zach Freemantle, who is fifth in the Big East with 16.9 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UConn (17-7, 9-4) won three of its last four games after a 70-66 win over No. 24 Creighton behind Liam McNeeley; Seton Hall (6-18, 1-12) lost nine straight since beating NJIT, 67-56, on Dec. 4, but won its last three home meetings with the Huskies.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (15-9, 6-7) defeated the Bulldogs, 73-70, on Jan. 31 behind 19 points from both Micah Peavy and Thomas Sorber after losing five of the previous six meetings; Butler (11-13, 4-9) won its last two games after an 82-81 win over Providence.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall claimed a 74-71 overtime victory over Georgetown in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 4, behind 27 points and 7 assists from Jada Eads; Victoria Rivera posted 26 points and 4 steals for the Hoyas in the loss on the road.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Nevada (14-10, 6-7) won 38 of its last 42 meetings with the Spartans after a 75-64 win on Jan. 18 behind 23 points from Nick Davidson and 15 from Xavier DuSell; San Jose State (12-14, 5-9) split its last 10 after a 69-66 loss to San Diego State.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 11 Michigan State (19-5, 10-3) dropped three of its last four, but beat the Fighting Illini, 80-78, on Jan. 19 behind 17 points from Tre Holloman; Illinois (17-8, 9-6) is 11-3 at home behind Kasparas Jakucionis, who leads the team with 16 ppg.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: The ARCA Menards Series heads to the Ride the 'Dente 200 at Daytona International Speedway for the opening race of the season in Daytona Beach, Florida; Gus Dean claimed the race win at Daytona in the season opener from the 2024 season.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (14-10, 5-8) ended a three-game skid with an 84-73 win over Rutgers; No. 25 Maryland (19-6, 9-5) is 14-1 at home behind freshman Derik Queen, who leads the team with 15.9 ppg, and won both meetings with the Hawkeyes last season.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Final Practice
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what final adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency for the Daytona 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 24 Creighton (18-7, 11-3) had its nine-win streak snapped by UConn, 70-66, but beat the Red Storm, 57-56, on Dec. 31; No. 9 St. John's (21-4, 12-2) is 15-0 at home behind RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East with 17.4 ppg.

programme.desc: Two-time Daytona 500 winner Bobby Allison picked up his fifth win at the 2.5-mile oval in the Firecracker 400 the previous year, as Bobby and his son, Davey, would make history in the 30th running of the prestigious NASCAR race.

programme.desc: Indy claimed a 3-1 victory over Orlando in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 11, behind 25 kills, 18 digs and 2 blocks from Leketor Member-Meneh; Brittany Abercrombie posted 17 kills and 9 digs for the Valkyries in the defeat.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The Dominican Republic is coming off of claiming a 1-0 victory over Aruba on Feb. 10 through a winning goal by Ismahel Saidani Sanchez in the 21st minute; Panama beat Grenada with an 8-0 scoreline, led by a hat-trick from Mikel Prado.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (15-9, 6-7) defeated the Bulldogs, 73-70, on Jan. 31 behind 19 points from both Micah Peavy and Thomas Sorber after losing five of the previous six meetings; Butler (11-13, 4-9) won its last two games after an 82-81 win over Providence.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall claimed a 74-71 overtime victory over Georgetown in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 4, behind 27 points and 7 assists from Jada Eads; Victoria Rivera posted 26 points and 4 steals for the Hoyas in the loss on the road.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Two-time Daytona 500 winner Bobby Allison picked up his fifth win at the 2.5-mile oval in the Firecracker 400 the previous year, as Bobby and his son, Davey, would make history in the 30th running of the prestigious NASCAR race.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Wests Tigers has finished last in the ladder in each of the three previous seasons; Canterbury-Bankstown has won three of the past four encounters, including a 22-14 triumph on May 4, as the Bulldogs held the Tigers scoreless in the second half.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Gold Coast (0-0-0) has won the past three meetings with the Broncos, including a 46-18 victory last season in Round 22, as Jojo Fifita scored three tries and Keano Kini notched two tries; Brisbane (0-0-0) finished 12th in the final ladder in 2024.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Saint Vincent is coming off of suffering a 5-0 defeat to Haiti on Feb. 11, where they conceded three goals in the first half, including a Nikolai Pierre brace; Antigua lost to Guatemala, 2-0, with their lone goal of the defeat scored by Sakidi Meade.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Barbados is coming off of a 1-0 victory over Dominica on Feb. 11 through an own-goal from Kimani Rodney in the 83rd minute of play; Belize suffered a 3-0 defeat to Mexico where they conceded a penalty in the 38th minute and two goals after halftime.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda is coming off of claiming a 3-1 victory over Anguilla on Feb. 9, led by a pair of goals from Kennahz Fray and 2 assists by Noah Outerbridge; Canada also comes off a win over Anguilla, on Feb. 11, 8-0, behind an Aidan Evans brace.

programme.desc: Mike Skinner starts the 500-mile race from the pole position and is joined on the front row by Steve Grissom; Dale Jarrett, who won the 200-lap race in 1996, and Dale Earnhardt start from Row 2 with Ernie Irvan and Jeff Gordon starting from Row 3.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Cuba and the United States last met in the second stage of the CONCACAF Championship on May 5, 2017, where the US claimed a 6-2 victory over Cuba; Timothy Weah found the net with a brace for the US in the win while each team had an own goal.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State claimed a 65-62 victory over West Virginia in March's Big 12 quarter-finals round, led by 22 points and 11 rebounds from Ayoka Lee; JJ Quinerly posted 27 points and 4 rebounds for the Mountaineers in the postseason loss.
